text: Any devs that work at HubSpot provide any feedback to my question above? It would really be appreciated.
what do you mean by “drag and drop editor”? The old Design Manager GUI way of making templates, or the new dnd page editor for content editors?

<@U3T21PDBK> I mean the drag and drop part of the page editor. Is it better to use HubSpots native fields via the page editor to create a website or better to use the boilerplate provided via GitHub and to build a themed website locally using HubSpot CLI.

I’ve never encountered a website where only hs native fields would please the client. A HubSpot theme experience for the content editor is a must IMO.

The boilerplate theme provides a good starting point to build themes. Furthermore, native hs fields are still available to content editors – no matter what theme they are using. Does that make sense?
